thread.title: Boston has first fall freeze, earliest in 36 years - Weather
thread.title_full: Boston has first fall freeze, earliest in 36 years - Weather

author: boston.com
title: Boston has first fall freeze, earliest in 36 years - Weather
text:
If you felt like it was freezing in Boston this morning, you were right.
Temperatures dipped to 31 degrees, marking the first time Boston has seen a freeze this early in 36 years, according to the National Weather Service.
Related Link Get today’s headlines right in your inbox It was the earliest freeze in Boston since Oct. 10, 1979, when Boston saw a low of 30 degrees, said Bill Simpson, a spokesperson for the National Weather Service in Boston.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below “On average, it’s seven to 10 days earlier than normal,” Simpson said.
We did not, however, beat any records for this date. The record low for Boston on Oct. 19 was 28 degrees, set back in 1922, said Simpson.
So does this mean we are in for an unusually cold winter? Nope, said Simpson.
“You cannot infer from this what the winter is going to be,” Simpson said. “There’s absolutely no correlation.”
